_comment: Unified Myki Configuration - Multi-user support with separate Myki accounts

_instructions.2_configure_users: Each key (e.g. 'koustubh') is both the config name AND the Myki username
_instructions.3_set_passwords: For each user, set environment variable: export MYKI_PASSWORD_{USERNAME}='password'

_field_notes.skipDates: Array of YYYY-MM-DD dates to exclude (OPTIONAL - defaults to [])
_field_notes.endDate: String, YYYY-MM-DD format, inclusive end (OPTIONAL - defaults to today)

koustubh._username_note: The key 'koustubh' IS the Myki username used for login

john._username_note: The key 'john' IS the Myki username used for login
john._note: Each user is a separate Myki account - they can track different cards/stations

_multi_user_explanation.scenario: Multiple people, each with their own Myki account
_multi_user_explanation.example: User 'koustubh' logs in with username 'koustubh', User 'john' logs in with username 'john'
_multi_user_explanation.authentication: Phase 1 authenticates EACH user separately and saves individual sessions
_multi_user_explanation.tracking: Phase 2 uses each user's session to fetch their transaction data
_multi_user_explanation.benefit: One tool can track attendance for multiple people automatically
_multi_user_explanation.simplicity: Config key = Myki username (no separate mykiUsername field needed)

_working_days_info.definition: Monday-Friday, excluding Melbourne VIC public holidays and user skip dates
